impacts.name: Tunguska Event
impacts.description: Largest impact event in recorded history, likely an airburst that flattened over 2,000 square kilometers of forest.

impacts.name: Chelyabinsk Meteor
impacts.description: A superbolide that exploded over Russia; its shockwave injured approximately 1,500 people, primarily from broken glass.

impacts.name: Chicxulub Impact
impacts.description: The massive impact event linked to the Cretaceous–Paleogene extinction event, which wiped out the non-avian dinosaurs.

impacts.name: Barringer Crater (Meteor Crater)
impacts.description: One of the best-preserved impact craters on Earth, formed by a nickel-iron meteorite.

impacts.name: Hoba Meteorite
impacts.description: The largest known intact meteorite on Earth. It did not form a crater, likely due to a low-angle entry and lower velocity.

impacts.name: Vredefort Crater
impacts.description: The largest verified impact structure on Earth, so ancient that the crater has largely eroded away.

impacts.name: Manicouagan Crater
impacts.description: One of the largest and best-preserved impact craters, now forming a distinctive ring-shaped lake.
